fileUploader.select: Select a file or drag it here
footer.msg: Â©Little Terrarium 2022 - Source code available at {$START_LINK}GitHub{$CLOSE_LINK}
general.afterUpload: After uploading, we must process your photos. Please, wait until this dialog closes.
general.formErrors: There are errors in the form. Please, check before submitting.
general.name: Name
general.uploadFinished: Upload finished. Processing your photos, please wait.
home.locations: Each location represents a place where your plants are living (i.e. a window, the balcony...). They will be your collections of plants.
home.locationsNote: Note that you don't need to have them all in the same place as you have physically. You can, for example, have Balcony (succulents) and Balcony (herbs).
light.fullsunDesc: Sun shines over the whole day
light.partialsunDesc: Sun is here for a few hours each day
location-add-edit.choose: Choose a nice, beautiful picture to showcase your nice, beautiful window/balcony/kitchen drawer/whatever!
location-add-edit.lightInfo: There's problably nothing as important for a plant than the sunlight (or the lack of).
location-add-edit.name: The name of a new location where your plants will live. Choose a recognisable name: window, balcony, coffee table...
location-add-edit.nameTip: Think: when talking to your friends about the plants here, how do you usually call it?
location-add-edit.ornot: Or, well, don't. Up to you.
location-add-edit.visibility: When your location is publicly visible, other users will be able to see it when visiting your user profile (given that it's public).
location-add-edit.visibilityNote: Note that your plants and pictures have their own privacy settings, so if you don't want to show some of your dying plants or blurry photos you can hide them individually even though your location is public.
location.remove: This will remove this location along with its plants and photos. Are you sure?
password-change.desc: Please set a new password below.
password-recovery.error: Sorry, we couldn't find the username or email provided.
password-recovery.info: Please, provide your username or your email and we'll send you a link to recover your password.
password-recovery.success: We've sent you an email with a link to recover your password. Just in case, check your spam folder!
password-recovery.title: Recover your password
password-reset.desc: Please set a new password below.
password-reset.invalidPassword: Password is invalid. Please follow the rules above.
password-reset.invalidToken: The link has expired or is invalid. Please, request the password recovery again.
password-reset.passwordChanged: The password has changed. Please, sign in again with the new password.
photo-add.addMsg: Time to brag about our well-cared, personal jungle.
photo-add.addMsgLimit: Up to 10 pictures at once! Once they're up, you can edit their description and if you need them in a specific order you can define when they were taken.
photo-add.visibility: When your picture is publicly visible, other users will be able to see it when visiting your user profile (given that it's public).
photo-add.visibilityNote: Note that your locations and plants have their own privacy settings, and they supersedes the picture's privacy setting (i.e. you can't share this picture if the plant is private).
photo-edit.description: Tell us a little bit about this photo. Does it represent a special moment in the growth of your plant?
photo-edit.takenAt: When was the photo taken? The gallery will be displayed in chronological order.
photo.remove: This will remove this photo. Are you sure?
plant-add.nameDesc: This is the happy moment when we add our beloved plants. First things first, identify! Want to give it a name?
plant-add.privacy: When your plant is publicly visible, other users will be able to see it when visiting your user profile (given that it's public).
plant-add.privacyTip: Note that your locations has its own privacy settings, and it supersedes the plant's privacy setting, so if the location is private users won't be able to see the location plant list, but you can share a direct link to this plant.
plant-add.specieDesc: Have you identified its specie? Search and select it from the list. You can use Pl@ntNet to identify it.
plant-edit-fertilizer.header: You need to eat and drink, and so do your plants! Again, know your plants, and give them the proper fertilizer they require.
plant-edit-fertilizer.lastTime: Do you remember when was the last time you fertilized it?
plant-edit-fertilizer.nextTime: How many days should you wait to feed your plant again?
plant-edit-fertilizer.type: What kind of fertilizer are you using? Give it a name (i.e. succulent fertilizer) or a NPK number.
plant-edit-soil.composition: Let's be a completionist and describe a bit what's your soil composition
plant-edit-soil.header: Editing soil and pot options for {$INTERPOLATION}
plant-edit-soil.material: What kind of material is your plant sitting on?
plant-edit-soil.potDesc: Nothing like finding a proper home to your plants, with a comfy floor!
plant-edit-soil.size: Do you know the diameter of your plant?
plant-edit-watering.lastTime: Do you remember when was the last time you watered it?
plant-edit-watering.nextTime: How many days should you wait to check your plant again?
plant-edit-watering.reminder: The watering frequency reminder should be used to remind yourself that your plant exists, and to check whether it requires your attention or not.
plant-edit-watering.sensitive: Many plants are extremely sensitive to overwatering, and many to drought.
plant-edit-watering.warning: So, first thing first: NEVER water your plants on a schedule! Know your plants, check the soil, learn about their necessities, and act accordingly.
plant-edit.description: Tell us something about your green friend: Where did you get it? When? How? Is it a variation of the common species? Is there an interesting story behind it?
plant-edit.health: Let's keep track of its health, would you?
plant-widget-fert.noData: Edit fertilizer data to see when this plant should be fed.
plant-widget-fertilizer.confirm: This will update your last time fertilized to today.
plant-widget-soil.composition: Your plant has a nice soil made up of {{soil}}.
plant-widget-soil.noData: Edit pot and soil data to see it here.
plant-widget-soil.title: Soil and Pot
plant-widget-water.confirm: This will update your last time watered to today.
plant-widget-water.noData: Edit watering data to see when this plant should be watered.
plant-widget-water.warning: If you haven't watered it yet, please check your soil. Never water your plants on a schedule!
plant.remove: This will remove this plant and all of its photos. Are you sure?
plants-all.msg: Here's a list of all the plants in your collection.
signin.homepageMsg: We are really happy to have you here. Sign in or sign up and start taking care of your plants!
signin.invalidCredentials: Sorry, the credentials are not valid.
tasks.msg: According to your plant settings, these are the tasks left to do. Blue drop, plant needs to drink; green spoon, plants need to eat!
themes.title: Themes
user-edit.avatarDesc: Also known as profile picture. Just an image to present yourself.
user-edit.bioDesc: Tell us something about yourself! How did you get in the green world, what kind of plants do you like, where are you based, etc.
user-edit.emailDesc: This is important! This is how you can recover your account in case you forget your password.
user-edit.fullnameDesc: In case you want to present yourself more professionally.
user-edit.privateProfile: If your profile is private, you won't be able to share it, but you'll still enjoy of all of the features of Little Terrarium.
user-edit.publicProfile: If your profile is public, you will be able to share it to whomever you want to, and brag about your plants.
user-edit.usernameDesc: This is how you'll be known around here, and how your profile will be accesed. Short, no spaces, no weird things.
user-register.emailDesc: This is how we identify you uniquely, and it's needed to receive notifications and to reset your password in case you forget it.
user-register.emailInvalid: Sorry, your e-mail is not formatted correctly.
user-register.emailTaken: Sorry, your e-mail already exists in our system. Are you sure you don't have an account already?
user-register.lookingForward: We are looking forward to welcoming you to our family!
user-register.passwordDesc: We're almost there. Last but not least, a password to protect your access
user-register.passwordLength: Password must be at least {{length}} characters long
user-register.usernameDesc: First of all, let's decide on your username. It may be the moniker you've been using for the last 20 years or something like your Instagram username.
user-register.usernameInvalid: Sorry, your username is not valid. Please, check the formatting.
user-register.usernameReq: It must be {$INTERPOLATION} to {$INTERPOLATION_1} characters long, and contain only alphanumeric characters, dot (.), dash (-) and underscore (_).
user-register.usernameTaken: Sorry, your username already exists. Please choose another.
